Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Pastor Ann Tiemyer (Pastor Ann), Trinity Lower East Side Lutheran, 602 E. 9th Street. New York, N.Y. 10009.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Rivera.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Pastor Ann Tiemyer (Pastor Ann) Trinity Lower East Side Lutheran, 602 East 9th Street, New York, N.Y. 10009.

Council Member Rivera moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of August 8, 2018 be adopted as printed by Council Member Cabrera.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Cabrera moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of August 8, 2018 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting the Mayor's Management Report,  Fiscal Year 2018.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor submitting the name of Sarah Carroll for appointment as a member of the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee (Council Member Salamanca) 
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application no.  C 180267 ZSQ, related to applications C 180265 ZMQ and N 180266 ZRQ, (69-02 Queens Boulevard), shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 69-02 Queens Boulevard, Queens (C 180267 ZSQ, 180265 ZMQ and N 180266 ZRQ)

Items.Title:
By Council Member King
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application no. C 180346 PSX (Bartow Avenue Animal Shelter) shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 2050 Bartow Avenue, Bronx (C 180346 PSX)

Items.Title: Resolution approving an exemption from real property taxes for property located at (Block 1612, Lot 1) Manhattan, pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 230).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 230 - Lakeview Apartments, Manhattan

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor to coordinate a review of cases involving persons convicted of a crime at the age of 16 or 17 years of age, before Raise the Age legislation went into effect, who are currently incarcerated or are sentenced in criminal court to ensure those sentences are equitable and just.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Juvenile Justice
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 2 Council Members formally noted their negative vote against this item: 
Council Members Borelli and Matteo.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Review of cases involving persons convicted of a crime at the age of 16 or 17 years of age, before Raise the Age legislation went into effect.

The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There were 50 Council Members marked present for this Stated Meeting.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, October 17,  2018.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
The Public Advocate (Ms James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.MinutesNote: At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
